title: At Home Saliva Test Detects Hidden Stress, Depression Risks - Neuroscience News
description: Researchers have developed a portable “lab-on-a-chip” device that measures cortisol levels from saliva, offering an objective and rapid way to assess stress and mental health risk.

title: FDA approves at-home HPV test to screen for cervical cancer - NBC News
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday approved the first at-home test to screen for cervical cancer, Teal Health, which makes the test kit, said.

title: Caffeine in Your Blood Could Affect Body Fat And Diabetes Risk, Study Shows - ScienceAlert
description: The levels of caffeine in your blood could affect the amount of body fat you carry, a factor that in turn could determine your risk of developing type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular diseases.

title: An Insider's View of the Texas Measles Outbreak : Shots - Health News - NPR
description: Katherine Wells, the public health director in Lubbock, Texas, describes her fight to stop the largest measles outbreak since 2000, despite a chaotic reorganization of federal health agencies.

title: ​US doctor shares 4 natural ways to remove microplastics from body - Times of India

title: B Vitamins May Halt Glaucoma Progression - Neuroscience News
description: Glaucoma damages the optic nerve and is usually managed by reducing eye pressure, though treatment effects vary.

title: Shingles vaccine reduces risk of heart disease by 23%, study of one million people finds - CNN
description: A study of more than one million people found the shingles vaccine may lower the risk of heart disease and stroke for up to eight years after the shots.

title: Annual blood test could detect cancer in its earliest stages - The Independent
description: Experts believe a national rollout of a universal cancer screening test may be less than a decade away

title: Feelings, Facts, and Our Crisis of Truth - The Dispatch
description: What we lose when the rigor of science and journalism give way to an aural and visual narrative culture.

title: Psychedelics Could 'Rewire' The Brain to Reduce Alcohol Consumption - ScienceAlert
description: Psychedelics like LSD and psilocybin (the active ingredient in magic mushrooms) are gaining increasing attention in psychiatry.

title: An expert trainer says this is the one thing that women need to understand about strength training - Fit&Well
description: Once you accept this fact, you’ll be able to experience the most satisfying part of exercise—getting stronger

title: Can Probiotics Reduce Stress, Anxiety, and Fatigue? A New Study Says Yes – In Just Two Weeks - SciTechDaily
description: Probiotics—often thought of as simply gut-friendly bacteria—may also play a powerful role in improving emotional well-being. New research using daily mood reports revealed that taking probiotics for just a few weeks significantly reduced negative feelings lik…

title: Golden Retriever Puppies’ Heartwarming Visit to Senior Center Couldn’t Be More Perfect - PetHelpful
description: Everyone had a smile on their face with these babies around!
